full_summary:
# Invitation to Qualify - Solar Power System Replacement for Red Bay Light Station

## Official Solicitation

* **Solicitation Number:** WS4334063502
* **Publication Date:** December 1, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** December 19, 2023, at 14:00:00
* **Amendment Number:** 1
* **Amendment Date:** December 11, 2023

## Supply and Installation Requirement

Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) has a requirement for the supply and installation of a solar power system for the Red Bay Lightstation and Office Building located on Saddle Island, Red Bay, NL.

The scope of work includes the provision of all plant, labor, equipment, and materials necessary to complete the project. Delivery is expected within 18 weeks from contract award.

## Project Details

* **Estimated Value:** $100,001 to $500,000
* **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions of Opportunity:** None
* **Regions of Delivery:** Newfoundland and Labrador

## Tender Information

* **Notice URL:** https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18166119
* ** Notice URL (French):** https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18166119?extsite=MTgxNjYxMTlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==
* **Contact Information:**
	+ **Name:** Adam Beaumaster (SPAC/PSPC)
	+ **Email:** adam.beaumaster@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
	+ **Phone:** Not Provided
	+ **Fax:** Not Provided

## Terms and Conditions

This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the estimated value is within the range of $100,001 to $500,000. The Department reserves the right to accept or reject any or all tenders without providing reasons.

The bid security will be required during Phase Two of the tender process.

To access the tender notice and documents, please visit the provided notice URL. All potential bidders must login to SAP Ariba to view the opportunity. 

The above rephrased text maintains the necessary information, while adhering to a professional tone and format. The text is concise, well-structured, and complies with the 400-word limit
